reviews.text: I did a wedding here as Justice of the Peace. A very beautiful seting.
Great place for a quiet walk and good views of the water.  Though dogs are not allowed,  many people ignore the signs completely.
Have been coming here since I was a little boy. I've kept the tradition going at least a few times per year. So peaceful and relaxing no matter what time of year you visit.

Lovely view of the Wachusett Reservoir. Great place to take photos and have a picnic. Very peaceful please. Open year round from sunrise to sunset. Due to the  reservoir being used for public drinking no wading, swimming, or boating of any kind allowed. Fishing is acceptable.
Beautiful church provides excellent backdrop for photos. A nice place to spend an hour.
Small parking area at trail head. Nice trails. Link to misstate trail.

Nice place to start a hike, small parking area can accommodate about 8 cars.  It's on the midstate trail, which is well marked trail and family friendly.  One direction takes you to Mt. Wachusett summit and the other crosses rt 140 to crow hill ledges (about 2.5 miles one way).  On the other side of crow hill is leominster state forest, it's fun to hike over the ledges and down into that LSF where you can add a loop to your hike up (from .5 to about 7 more miles).  Picture is the picnic area at crow hill ledges between redemption rock and leominster state forest.
A interesting place to visit I have driven past it for years

Great place! The rock is literally right off the road.  There are a few trails, but we couldn't  find any trail maps. The trails have markers, but I'm not sure if they go anywhere. We stopped around a spot that was completely washed out and lost the markers.
Historical place with rocks, hills and streams.

Gorgeous vistas, rustic environ without any crowds. That's a rare combination unless you hike up a hard mountain. But that's what Fruitlands provides. The tours here give a nice historical view into how things were over a century ago when this place was considered radical.

We’ve captured two weddings here so far, in two different seasons on days with different weather and both weddings were downright magical. The view on the hill at sunset is a total dream, and the rest of the property has too many photo ops to count! Gorgeous place to get married with a very “New England” feel.
My cousin had her wedding here. Very accommodating. Buy the honey!
I attended a wedding here. Lovely venue. Great food. Spectacular views of the Wachussett Valley.
Helpful friendly staff... I loved the new exhibit where we dressed in period clothing and the nice woman took our picture..:) breath taking view more enjoyable in the summer..

I have not had the pleasure of visiting a European Christmas market (yet), but I imagine Vaillancourt Folk Art is the closest thing to being in those Christmas markets. I bought my first chalkware piece at the Old Sturbridge Village but this time I decided to visit the Sutton store and studio. The store consists of many objects for sale that are made right on site as well as some German made items. This is not a place to find cheaply made Christmas decorations but high quality collectibles. Being a lover of Christmas, I bought a magnificent piece that now adorns my entertainment center joining the Twelve Days of Christmas glass ornaments that my wife received last year. I hope these items are passed along in my family for many generations. Vaillancourt Folk Art is the place to go to truly appreciate and feel the spirit of Christmas. Stop by and take a look at the collectibles, items for sale and tour the production shop. Buy a bottle of wine, a small ornament or elaborate chalkware. We are truly fortunate to have this home grown local store right here in central Massachusetts.

I never have been to a folk art museum before I don't know much about folk art, but I figured it wouldn't hurt to check it out so I did, and I am so glad I did. It felt like I was celebrating Christmas in a magical wonderland. Everywhere I looked there was Christmas decorations, and some of the most chalk art I have ever seen. Even though my back was in a ton of pain it was well worth the pain. If you have not seen it yet I recommend it because you will not be disappointed. I would give it ten stars.
Absolutely a treasure.. loved seeing G.Charles Dickens one man telling of "A Christmas Carol"-  Totally awesome performance in an intimate setting. What a blessing to have this here.
Beautiful display of ornamental decorations
Good if you want to buy a nice gift for someone.

An incredible museum! Very friendly and knowledgeable guide. A wonderful living time capsule, where every doorway is a time machine. With original furnishings and artifacts dating to the early 18th Century to the early 20th, it is truly a gem in central Mass.
What a pleasure to enjoy magnificent food! Went for Christmas dinner, and it was worth it. Service top notch. Anxious to return to order off the menu. Food was amazing and beautifully presented.

One of the worst dinning experience my husband and I have had! The food is ok, but over priced, and the service we had was the worst ever. We will not be returning there . We enjoyed the one in Princeton, but they obviously did not survive the move in our opinion.
Delicious and inventive food. Very pleasant service and an understanding for pacing a meal rather than turning tables.
Compliments to the chef. Excellence as expected. Very attentive wait staff.

Sonoma is the restaurant inside The Beechwood in Worcester. It's a standard restaurant for a nice hotel.  There isn't much stand-out about it good or bad. I really enjoyed their duck, which isn't easy to find in Worcester, and the cocktails were good.

Delicious fresh ice cream. They have so many creative flavors! I recommend looking at the flavors on their website before going, because the ice cream names on the menu aren't always descriptive. My favorite are the chocolate chip crunch and the reverse Oreo. It can definitely get busy, but it's worth the wait. The little country store has some great selections of meats and home cooked food.

Open early March - mid November.  It is excellent ice cream. Very rich.  Always top ingredients. Many flavors, and seasonal special flavors.  The farm store has great stuff: grass fed beef, frozen meals, sweets, fruit & veg, jars of jams and pickles.... Oh yes and you can watch the goats and cows.

Open early in the season and closes late in the season, what more could you ask for? Best, creamy ice cream with so many flavors! My favorite: coffee Oreo! Also they have really cute dog ice cream treats, and cows and goats to watch!
Best homemade ice cream ever,  the parking lot may look packed, but service was quick.  Can't wait to go back for more.  The variety of ice cream was amazing.
Great quality ice cream and fun to watch the cows. Best ice cream around this area. Love them
Very friendly staff and environment. Food was delicious. Very clean and well maintained.

We all gathered there after our training. The food was a 4 and the de-caf coffee was not even a 1 star, bitter and burnt not a great combo. All of the food was delivered in a timely manner.  Staff was pleasant. Prices were good. A wide variety to choose from on the menu.
Food is Awesome.  Great serving amounts. Taste is very good. Service is right on. Not a ton load of parking. But, all in all, a place, must, go to eat. Highly recommend it!
Good food even better cooks and wait staff
Great food nice atmosphere and friendly waitstaff
